result.execSummary:
The defendant Cory M Pate was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Forgery-Uttering, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.38(2).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Defendant is eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program.
Defendant is eligible for Substance Abuse Program.

Consecutive to: Current prison sentence
Concurrent with: 21CM978

miscConds.notes:
Costs to be paid as a condition of probation.

Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.

Submit to an AODA assessment, follow through with any treatment, counseling.  No use or possession of alcohol or illegal drugs/drug paraphernalia. Comply with random urine screens.  Maintain absolute sobriety. No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription. Valid prescriptions only with prior agent approval and to be taken only in the manner they are prescribed.

Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling. 
Case 21CM1842, 21CT509, & 22CM284 are dismissed and read-in. 
If Probation/Extended Supervision is revoked and/or a prison term ordered, outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.  If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collections may include income assignment.

records.addlTxt: Effective August 1, 2022, this case is assigned to Branch 4, the Honorable Lloyd V. Carter, pursuant to 22-SO-04(67).

with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

District Attorney's Office Law Intern, Abigail Kincheloe, appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
Defendant Cory M Pate in court, in custody (by zoom from DCI), with attorney Ricardo Tapia.   
Victim rights have been complied with by the Waukesha County District Attorneys Office.
Cases:  21CM1842, 21CT509 & 22CM284 are dismissed as read ins.
Jury Trial Cancelled.

Defendant enters a plea of Guilty to count 1.
Court finds the defendant Guilty of count 1.
Count 2 is dismissed as a read in.

FELONY WARNINGS PROVIDED:  REGARDING VOTING AND FIREARM RESTRICTIONS.

Court orders the following:
Total Prison:  6 Years.
Initial Confinement:  3 Years
Extended Supervision:  3 Years.
STAYED.

IF REVOKED:  
Defendant is eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program.
Defendant is eligible for Substance Abuse Program.  

Term of Probation:  2 Years.
Concurrent to:  21CM978
Consecutive to:  Current prison sentence.
CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:  
AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended;
Absolute Sobriety; Random U.A.'s ; 
No Use or Possession of alcohol, controlled substances or drug paraphernalia.
No Use or Possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription;
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of all prescriptions
Follow through with any assessments, evaluations, treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent; 
Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling 
DNA sample to be provided if not yet previously done.

COSTS:  $ 268
DRGOD:  $10
DNA SAMPLE AND SURCHARGE:  $250
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
To be paid as a Condition of the Sentence.
